title: ‘I feel like a ghost’: new father deported by ICE to Bhutan that exiled his family
description: pMohan Karki – one of many people ICE has deported to countries with which they have little connection – leaves behind his wife and seven-month-old baby he has yet to hold/ppTika Basnet sat facing the glow of her iPhone, a red emtika/em pressed into the center of her forehead. Seven-month-old Briana slept on her lap, her breathing soft and uneven. On the other side of the screen was Mohan Karki, Basnet’s husband, who had yet to hold his daughter./ppFor Karki, nearly 9,000 miles (14,500km) away, it was already morning. He was in hiding in south Asia, his exact location withheld for his safety, his face breaking into pixels as he watched his daughter sleep./p a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2026/feb/15/bhutanese-nepali-refugee-ice-trump-immigration"Continue reading.../a

title: Trump illegally used executive power to impose global tariffs, supreme court rules
description: pUS president vows to enact 10% global baseline tariff after calling the supreme court justices ‘a disgrace to the nation’/pullipa href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2026/feb/20/us-iran-nuclear-deal-trump-agreement-strikes-latest-news-live-updates"US politics live – latest updates/a/p/li/ulpThe a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/us-supreme-court"US supreme court/a declared many of a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump"Donald Trump/a’s tariffs illegal on Friday, in a sharp rebuke that topples a key pillar of the president’s aggressive economic agenda./ppIn a 6-3 ruling, the court decided that a 1977 law designed to address national emergencies did not provide the legal justification for most of the Trump administration’s a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/trump-tariffs"tariffs/a on countries across the world. It is the first time the court has overruled one of Trump’s second-term policies./p a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2026/feb/20/trump-supreme-court-tariffs-ruling"Continue reading.../a

title: ‘Al-Aqsa is a detonator’: six-decade agreement on prayer at Jerusalem holy site collapses
description: pIsraeli police raid compound, arrest staff and curb Muslims’ access as Ramadan begins /ppA six-decade agreement governing Muslim and Jewish prayer at Jerusalem’s most sensitive holy site has “collapsed” under pressure from Jewish extremists backed by the Israeli government, experts have warned./ppA series of arrests of Muslim caretaker staff, bans on access for hundreds of Muslims, and escalating incursions by radical Jewish groups culminated this week in the arrest of an imam of al-Aqsa mosque and an Israeli police raid during evening prayers on the first night of Ramadan./p a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2026/feb/20/status-quo-collapsed-prayer-jerusalem-al-aqsa-mosque-ramadan"Continue reading.../a

title: A fragile freedom for Venezuela’s released political prisoners
Residents in northern Lebanon terrified their buildings will collapse
Hamas reportedly holds leadership vote at critical moment for militant group
description: pNew head will face decisions crucial to movement’s future, such as how far to cooperate with Trump’s Gaza plan/ppHamas has reportedly begun holding leadership elections among its members at a time when the militant Palestinian movement faces imminent decisions which will be critical to its own continued existence and the potential for peace in Gaza./ppAccording to the BBC and press reports in the Gulf, Hamas members in Gaza have already voted. Those in the West Bank, in Israeli prisons and the diaspora are also expected to cast ballots for delegates to the movement’s 50-member general Shura council, which ultimately chooses its politburo and a new interim leader. The process could last weeks./p a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2026/feb/20/hamas-reportedly-holds-leadership-vote-at-critical-moment-for-militant-group"Continue reading.../a

title: UN emergency food aid in Somalia may halt by April amid severe hunger
RSF siege of El Fasher in Sudan has ‘hallmarks of genocide’, UN mission finds
description: pReport details harrowing 18-month occupation of North Darfur capital, showing destruction aimed at ethnic communities/ppThe a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2025/oct/27/fears-civilians-sudan-paramilitary-rsf-capture-el-fasher"siege and capture/a of the Sudanese city of El Fasher by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces group last October bore “the hallmarks of genocide”, a UN-mandated fact-finding mission has said./ppIn a report detailing the harrowing 18-month occupation of the capital of North Darfur, investigators concluded that the RSF and allied militias deliberately inflicted conditions calculated to bring about the physical destruction of the Zaghawa and Fur ethnic communities./p a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2026/feb/19/rsf-siege-el-fasher-sudan-hallmarks-of-genocide-un-mission-north-darfur"Continue reading.../a

title: Osaka stunned by anonymous gift of gold bars to fix ageing water pipes
description: pMayor says Japanese city will respect donor’s specification that £2.7m gift must be used to repair dilapidated system/ppOsaka has received a hefty gift of gold bars worth 560m yen (£2.7m) from an anonymous donor and a request for its specific use: to fix the Japanese city’s dilapidated water pipes./ppThe gold bars, weighing a total of 21kg (46lb), were given to the Osaka City Waterworks Bureau in November by the donor who wants to help improve ageing water pipes, the mayor, Hideyuki Yokoyama, told reporters on Thursday./p a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2026/feb/20/osaka-stunned-by-anonymous-gift-of-36m-in-gold-to-fix-ageing-water-pipes"Continue reading.../a

title: History redressed: Melania makes her mark, in a fashion, with Smithsonian gown
description: pFirst lady is first in more than 100 years to have two inaugural gowns in museum’s popular collection/ppHer husband has described it as “OUT OF CONTROL”, a place where “everything discussed is how horrible our Country is, how bad Slavery was, and how unaccomplished the downtrodden have been”./ppBut a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/melania-trump"Melania Trump/a, the wife of US president a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump"Donald Trump/a, declared a temporary ceasefire in hostilities with the Smithsonian Institution in Washington on Friday – with the help of a silk gown, diamond brooch and headless mannequin./p a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2026/feb/20/melania-smithsonian-inaugural-dress"Continue reading.../a
